title: 22d10. Beauty school instructors, career school instructors.
text:
To
determine the exempt status of an instructor at a beauty school or other
post-secondary career school, the first criteria that must be met is whether
the instructor is employed in an educational establishment. Factors relevant in
determining whether post-secondary career programs are educational institutions
include whether the school is licensed by a state agency responsible for the
state’s educational system or accredited by a nationally recognized accrediting
organization for career schools. If the educational establishment test is met,
the duties of the instructor must be examined to determine if the primary duty
is teaching, as defined in 29 CFR § 541.303. WHD

To determine the exempt status of an instructor at a beauty school or other post-secondary career school, the first criteria that must be met is whether the instructor is employed in an educational establishment. Factors relevant in determining whether post-secondary career programs are educational institutions include whether the school is licensed by a state agency responsible for the state’s educational system or accredited by a nationally recognized accrediting organization for career schools. If the educational establishment test is met, the duties of the instructor must be examined to determine if the primary duty is teaching, as defined in 29 CFR § 541.303.
